title: Ryze Champion Update
body: Did I miss something or has Ryze ninja-ed Yorick in the Champion Update Schedule? With the Taric update complete, I was checking to see whom was on the table AFTER Yorick in hopes to see a Gameplay update of someone like Urgot or maybe some Visual Updates for Morgana or Evelynn.

Anyone else find it funny that we have this champ update schedule but Riot never sticks to it and just does whatever the hell they feel like doings anyways?

The schedule is just a vague outline of what they are planning on doing. The Yorick team was slated to be done next, as he was started earlier. But the Ryze team is closer to being done, despite starting later, since they had less they had to do. Would you rather have the champs in the order that Riot said they would come in, even if it made the updates take longer, or would you rather have the champs updated when their updates were done, regardless of when the estimate theorised they would be done?

I personally like the second one, because it means that more updates would be done in a shorter amount of time, rather than focusing on one, then starting on the next after that one is released. I mean just look at this;

> This is correct. Yorick is a much larger rework then Ryze and also is a minionmancer, which is generally a heavy resource type of champion. This means that although the team working on Ryze started later, Ryze will most likely come before Yorick. This is subject to change of course.

Yorick is taking longer because they not only have to code him, but also his minions, which are central to his identity.

Now if they said Yorick was next with Ryze after, then they updated Rumble first, you would have a point.

Davidlikeseggs{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

While he is still in meta he is definitely hard to balance. And that is part of the reason why. The fact that his kit is so unhealthy AND he is meta, and continues to be despite any nerfs that go through is even more reason to rework him. The current thinking is to make Ryze easier to use rather then harder to use, while also adding a bit more decision making to his kit. 

We were originally working on him as part of the Mage roster update but realized that we would need much larger art changes to fix Ryze's core problems, hence the VGU.

We will be updating ALL of his skin splashes as well for this update.

Edit: ALL skin splashes except whitebeard

> Aren't there other champions that this also applies to, more than Ryze?

No.

The other really hard to play champions are stuff like Lee Sin who not only has high mechanical difficulty, but also requires a lot of quick decision making with strategic implications. Lee Sin has to find someone out of position and kick them into his team, move around the battle field to deal damage without taking too much damage, if he has to fall back on a tank build to survive then his damage potential is weakened and he has to lean on utility.

Ryze runs at people and casts spells until they die. He does it in a way that's a major pain in the ass to perform, but strategically it's just 1: move forward 2: cast spells and either he has enough stats to make the enemy move back until he gets an objective, or he isn't farmed enough yet and the enemy fights back and kills him.

And with other difficult to play champions, players understand that those champions are difficult to play, they realize why they can't just pick up Lee Sin, land skill shots, and perform perfect tower dives without just dying. Ryze however is often completely misidentified by players as easy to play. Before the rework that changed his Q to a skillshot, players thought he was one of the easiest champions in the game when statistics showed that he had one of the highest skill floors of any champion and was almost completely useless if your ping wasn't well below 100. That sentiment has lessened a lot since the change to Q, but I still see players from time to time see a Ryze game and say "Oh that champion looks easy, you just spam all your spells and win"

I like his kit right now- maybe his ult could use a change, but otherwise he is good. Imo the problem is the numbers. All you need to do is buy a rod of ages and have a decent amount of cdr, and you have a 2 second easy to hit q spam with big damage. His scalings are a bit too high- maybe giving q a slight cast time or making the projectile slower/easier to dodge would give him more counterplay. I do not think he really needs a full rework.
